items.title: Washington Post publisher Will Lewis abruptly resigns amid criticism of staff cuts
items.standfirst: Departure comes days after newspaper laid off nearly one-third of staff, including more than 300 journalistsWill Lewis, the Murdoch media veteran who took over as publisher and chief executive of the Washington Post in early 2024, announced abruptly on Saturday evening that he is leaving the company.His departure comes just three days after the Post laid off nearly one-third of its entire staff, citing the need to cut costs and reposition the money-losing publication. Lewis, who did not appear on the all-staff meeting during which the cuts were announced, has faced criticism for his absence and leadership. Continue reading...
items.content: Departure comes days after newspaper laid off nearly one-third of staff, including more than 300 journalistsWill Lewis, the Murdoch media veteran who took over as publisher and chief executive of the Washington Post in early 2024, announced abruptly on Saturday evening that he is leaving the company.His departure comes just three days after the Post laid off nearly one-third of its entire staff, citing the need to cut costs and reposition the money-losing publication. Lewis, who did not appear on the all-staff meeting during which the cuts were announced, has faced criticism for his absence and leadership. Continue reading...

items.title: 'We will pay,' US TV host Savannah Guthrie says in plea for mother's return
'We will pay,' Savannah Guthrie says in desperate video plea to potential kidnappers of her mother
items.standfirst: Today show host tells potential kidnappers of mother Nancy that family is prepared to pay for safe returnSavannah Guthrie told the potential kidnappers of her mother, Nancy Guthrie, on Saturday that the family is prepared to pay for her safe return, as the frantic search for the 84-year-old entered a seventh day.“We received your message, and we understand. We beg you now to return our mother to us so that we can celebrate with her,” she said in a video posted on social media, flanked by her siblings. “This is the only way we will have peace. This is very valuable to us, and we will pay.” Continue reading...
items.content: Today show host tells potential kidnappers of mother Nancy that family is prepared to pay for safe returnSavannah Guthrie told the potential kidnappers of her mother, Nancy Guthrie, on Saturday that the family is prepared to pay for her safe return, as the frantic search for the 84-year-old entered a seventh day.“We received your message, and we understand. We beg you now to return our mother to us so that we can celebrate with her,” she said in a video posted on social media, flanked by her siblings. “This is the only way we will have peace. This is very valuable to us, and we will pay.” Continue reading...

clusters.title: Brad Arnold of Grammy-nominated rock band 3 Doors Down dies aged 47
clusters.neutral_headline: Brad Arnold of Grammy-nominated rock band 3 Doors Down dies aged 47
bullet_summary: The band said in a statement on Saturday that Arnold “passed away peacefully, surrounded by loved ones, in his sleep after his courageous battle with cancer”
The Mississippi-born frontman of the popular rock band had announced a stage 4 cancer diagnosis in May 2025
He was the founder, lead singer, and songwriter for 3 Doors Down
Brad Arnold, the founder and lead singer of the 3 Doors Down has died following "his courageous battle with cancer," the rock band announced Saturday on social media

items.title: Brad Arnold of Grammy-nominated rock band 3 Doors Down dies aged 47
items.standfirst: Lead singer died on Saturday, months after he announced that he had been diagnosed with stage 4 kidney cancerBrad Arnold, the lead singer of the Grammy-nominated rock band 3 Doors Down, has died, months after he announced that he had been diagnosed with stage 4 kidney cancer. He was 47.The band said in a statement on Saturday that Arnold “passed away peacefully, surrounded by loved ones, in his sleep after his courageous battle with cancer”. Continue reading...
items.content: Lead singer died on Saturday, months after he announced that he had been diagnosed with stage 4 kidney cancerBrad Arnold, the lead singer of the Grammy-nominated rock band 3 Doors Down, has died, months after he announced that he had been diagnosed with stage 4 kidney cancer. He was 47.The band said in a statement on Saturday that Arnold “passed away peacefully, surrounded by loved ones, in his sleep after his courageous battle with cancer”. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Veteran French politician quits as head of prestigious institute after Epstein links revealed
clusters.neutral_headline: France investigates ex-minister Jack Lang over Epstein links
bullet_summary: The day before, France’s financial crimes prosecutors announced they had opened a probe into the Lang family’s ties with Epstein
Reported by Guardian World, BBC World, France24

items.title: Veteran French politician quits as head of prestigious institute after Epstein links revealed
items.standfirst: Former culture minister Jack Lang resigns from Arab World Institute in Paris and is also subject of tax investigationJack Lang, a former French culture minister, has resigned as head of Paris’s prestigious Arab World Institute after revelations of his past contacts with the disgraced financier and sex offender Jeffrey Epstein and the launch of a financial investigation by French prosecutors.Lang, 86, resigned on Saturday night before he was due to attend an urgent meeting called by the French foreign ministry to discuss his links to Epstein. Continue reading...
items.content: Former culture minister Jack Lang resigns from Arab World Institute in Paris and is also subject of tax investigationJack Lang, a former French culture minister, has resigned as head of Paris’s prestigious Arab World Institute after revelations of his past contacts with the disgraced financier and sex offender Jeffrey Epstein and the launch of a financial investigation by French prosecutors.Lang, 86, resigned on Saturday night before he was due to attend an urgent meeting called by the French foreign ministry to discuss his links to Epstein. Continue reading...

items.title: France investigates ex-minister Jack Lang over Epstein links
items.standfirst: The socialist grandee quits his role at a prestigious institute as he is investigated for the "laundering of tax-fraud proceeds".
items.content: The socialist grandee quits his role at a prestigious institute as he is investigated for the "laundering of tax-fraud proceeds".

items.title: France’s former minister Jack Lang ‘offers’ to resign from Arab World Institute over Epstein links
items.standfirst: Jack Lang, France’s former culture minister, on Saturday “offered” to resign as head of the prestigious Arab World Institute in Paris after he and his daughter Caroline were mentioned in the latest batch of documents related to the late financier and sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. The day before, France’s financial crimes prosecutors announced they had opened a probe into the Lang family’s ties with Epstein. Lang is also due to appear before Foreign Minister Jean-Noël Barrot after being summoned.
items.content: Jack Lang, France’s former culture minister, on Saturday “offered” to resign as head of the prestigious Arab World Institute in Paris after he and his daughter Caroline were mentioned in the latest batch of documents related to the late financier and sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. The day before, France’s financial crimes prosecutors announced they had opened a probe into the Lang family’s ties with Epstein. Lang is also due to appear before Foreign Minister Jean-Noël Barrot after being summoned.

items.title: Paris probes Jack Lang over Epstein link
items.standfirst: In France, all eyes are on Jack Lang, who has been summoned to the Quai d’Orsay tomorrow. The president of the Arab World Institute and his daughter, Caroline Lang, are both the subject of an investigation by the financial prosecutor’s office for aggravated money laundering linked to tax fraud. France 2 Benoit Chavatte and France 24 Daniel Quinlan take a closer look.
items.content: In France, all eyes are on Jack Lang, who has been summoned to the Quai d’Orsay tomorrow. The president of the Arab World Institute and his daughter, Caroline Lang, are both the subject of an investigation by the financial prosecutor’s office for aggravated money laundering linked to tax fraud. France 2 Benoit Chavatte and France 24 Daniel Quinlan take a closer look.

clusters.title: Trump pushes for peace in Ukraine ‘by June’, Zelensky says
clusters.neutral_headline: Zelenskyy says US has set June deadline for Ukraine-Russia peace deal
bullet_summary: Ukraine’s President Volodymyr Zelensky on Saturday said Washington has proposed that Russian and Ukrainian negotiators meet in the United States next week to discuss a possible peace deal
“They say they want to do everything by June,” Zelensky said of the US mediators
The United States wants Kyiv and Moscow to end the nearly four-year war by June, and has offered to host talks between the two sides next week, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said
Zelenskyy said the Trump administration “will probably put pressure” on Ukraine and Russia to end the war by the beginning of the summer

items.title: Trump pushes for peace in Ukraine ‘by June’, Zelensky says
items.standfirst: Ukraine’s President Volodymyr Zelensky on Saturday said Washington has proposed that Russian and Ukrainian negotiators meet in the United States next week to discuss a possible peace deal. “They say they want to do everything by June,” Zelensky said of the US mediators.

items.title: US sets deadline for peace deal between Ukraine and Russia
items.standfirst: The United States wants Kyiv and Moscow to end the nearly four-year war by June, and has offered to host talks between the two sides next week, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said. If the June deadline is not met, the Trump administration will likely put pressure on both sides to meet it, he added. France24 International Affairs editor Andrew Hilliars explains.

The Ukrainian president also told reporters that both sides had been invited to further talks next week.Zelenskyy said the Trump administration “will probably put pressure” on Ukraine and Russia to end the war by the beginning of the summer. “They say they want to get everything done by June,” he said. “They will do everything to end the war and they want a clear schedule of all events.” Continue reading...

(Source: Bloomberg)

clusters.title: RSF drone attack kills 24 people fleeing fighting in central Sudan, says doctors group
clusters.neutral_headline: Sudan drone attack kills 24 people, including eight children
bullet_summary: The vehicle was transporting displaced people who fled fighting in the Dubeiker area, the group said in a statement
Reported by Guardian World, Sky News World

items.title: RSF drone attack kills 24 people fleeing fighting in central Sudan, says doctors group
items.standfirst: Eight children including two infants among dead in vehicle carrying displaced people, says Sudan Doctors NetworkA drone attack by a paramilitary group has hit a vehicle carrying displaced families in central Sudan, killing at least 24 people, including eight children, a doctors’ group said on Saturday.The attack by the Rapid Support Forces took place close to the city of Er Rahad in North Kordofan province, according to the Sudan Doctors Network, which tracks the country’s war. The vehicle was transporting displaced people who fled fighting in the Dubeiker area, the group said in a statement. Among the dead children were two infants. Continue reading...
items.content: Eight children including two infants among dead in vehicle carrying displaced people, says Sudan Doctors NetworkA drone attack by a paramilitary group has hit a vehicle carrying displaced families in central Sudan, killing at least 24 people, including eight children, a doctors’ group said on Saturday.The attack by the Rapid Support Forces took place close to the city of Er Rahad in North Kordofan province, according to the Sudan Doctors Network, which tracks the country’s war. The vehicle was transporting displaced people who fled fighting in the Dubeiker area, the group said in a statement. Among the dead children were two infants. Continue reading...
